dt: {bc}of, relating to, characteristic of, or constituting a city

shortdef: of, relating to, characteristic of, or constituting a city
name of 8 popes: especially II (Odo of Lagery) circa 1035—1099 (pope 1088—99)

dt: {bc}a subdivision of an administrative county especially in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland

shortdef: a subdivision of an administrative county especially in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland

dt: {bc}an often lurid story or anecdote that is based on hearsay and widely circulated as true

dt.t: the {it}urban legend{/it} of alligators living in the sewers

shortdef: an often lurid story or anecdote that is based on hearsay and widely circulated as true —called also urban myth

dt: {bc}one whose job is to develop comprehensive plans and designs for the use of space within cities, towns, developments, etc.

dt.t: The intense competition for space among residential, industrial, recreational, agricultural, and transportation interests presents a continual series of problems to the {wi}urban planner{/wi}.

utxt.t: Disney threw himself obsessively into the park's design, which anticipated many of the best features of modern {wi}urban planning{/wi} …

shortdef: one whose job is to develop comprehensive plans and designs for the use of space within cities, towns, developments, etc.

dt: {bc}a construction program to replace or restore substandard buildings in an urban area

shortdef: a construction program to replace or restore substandard buildings in an urban area

dt: {bc}the spreading of urban developments (such as houses and shopping centers) on undeveloped land near a city

shortdef: the spreading of urban developments (such as houses and shopping centers) on undeveloped land near a city

dt: {bc}opposed to or hostile toward {d_link|cities|city} in general

dt.t: The violent hostility of Renamo toward such symbols of modernity as schools, hospitals, and machinery feeds the idea that the movement is traditionalist, or simply {wi}anti-urban{/wi}.

shortdef: opposed to or hostile toward cities in general
